pylapp.smoothclicker.android.json

Class JsonFileParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.json.JsonFileParser

  • public class JsonFileParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which parses the JSON file which must contain the points to click on. based on the "singleton" design pattern. 
             adb push myFile.json /storage/emulated/legacy/Download/
    Since:
    04/05/2016
    Version:
    1.6.0
    Author:
    pylapp

    • Method Detail

      • parseJsonPointsFile

        private java.util.List<PointsListAdapter.Point> parseJsonPointsFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                             throws NotSuitableJsonPointsFileException
        Parses the JSON file which contains the points to click on
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The name of the file to process
        Returns:
        List - The points picked form the JSON file
        Throws:
        NotSuitableJsonPointsFileException - - If something wrong occurs during the parse

      • getPointFromJsonFile

        public int[] getPointFromJsonFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws NotSuitableJsonPointsFileException
        Returns the point in the JSON file. Will load in a first time the JSON file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - The name of the file to process
        Returns:
        int[] -
        Throws:
        NotSuitableJsonPointsFileException - - If something wrong occurs with the JSON file

      • parseConfigFile

        public void parseConfigFile(Context c,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws NotSuitableJsonConfigFileException
        Parses the JSON file which contains the config to apply on th click process
        Parameters:
        c - - The context which enables to update the shard preferences, must not be null
        fileName - = The name of the file to process
        Throws:
        NotSuitableJsonConfigFileException - - If a problem occurs with the JSON config file

      • getFullPathToConfigFile

        public static java.lang.String getFullPathToConfigFile()
        Returns:
        String - The path to the JSON config file
